18. Have you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

Would have given all I had or hoped to have for food on one trip for wood—using oxen. Better home with lunch—expecting to be home the same day—were away some three days—to homes or food available.

Broth in food requirements (20 miles) to last three months—ran short—boiled the brown sugar bag to salvage the sweetness left in it for lunch—killed to Mr. Jaw after 8 months—nothing left for lunch—cooked it in a pan and enjoyed the feast.

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

Would have given all I had or hoped to have for food on one trip for wood - using oxen left home with lunch - expecting to be home the same day. We were away some three days - no homes or food available. Brot in food + requirements (80 miles) to last three months. Ran short + boiled the brown sugar bag to salvage the sweetness left in it. Returning to M. Saw after 3 months - nothing left for lunch - killed a young rabbit with the draw-pins of a wagon - cooked it in a pail + enjoyed the feast.
